links.title: Apple Patent Points to Face ID coming to Apple Watch along with Band Sensors to Analyze Sports Performance and more
links.description: This week the US Patent & Trademark Office published a patent application from Apple that relates to new Apple Watch features on the drawing board. Perhaps the most popular feature will be adding a camera into the face of Apple Watch for Face ID and other applications.

message.body: $HIMX $AAPL Apple Watch 4 Could Feature Face ID  https://www.forbes.com/sites/paullamkin/2018/03/26/apple-watch-4-could-feature-face-id/#b76c3b83ac06

links.title: Apple Watch 4 Could Feature Face ID
links.description: Share to email Share to facebook Share to twitter Share to linkedin Share to google Opinions expressed by Forbes Contributors are their own. The next Apple smartwatch - likely to be unveiled in September and likely to be dubbed the Apple Watch Series 4 (if Apple sticks to the plan of the last couple of years) - could feature the Face ID tech that is built into the company's latest flagship smartphone: the iPhone X.

links.title: They Tried to Boycott Facebook, Apple and Google. They Failed.
links.description: SAN FRANCISCO - Ryan Knight, a Democratic activist in Los Angeles, called for a boycott of Apple in February because it hadn't responded to calls to delete a channel from the National Rifle Association from its streaming-video service after the Parkland, Fla., school shooting. "Dear @Apple," Mr. Knight wrote on Twitter.

links.title: It's Time to Get Greedy With These Dividend Stocks
links.description: Investors looking to prosper could do worse than following the advice of Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett -- one of the most celebrated and successful investors of all time. Since 1965, the company has produced compounded annual gains of nearly 21% and increased by a mind-boggling 2,404,748%!
